organizations: United States Circuit Court of Appeals
lead_paragraph: The United States Supreme Court denied a petition to hear arguments in the sexual harassment case against the women’s coach at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, knocking down the final legal barrier to a jury trial. The former player Melissa Jennings first sued Coach Anson Dorrance in 1998, saying he maintained a hostile environment filled with sexual harassment. Jennings, a former backup goalkeeper, said the abuse violated Title IX by denying her the benefits of collegiate sports.United States District Court Judge N. Carlton Tilley Jr. in Greensboro, N.C., had dismissed Jennings’s lawsuit in October 2004, but the 4th United States Circuit Court of Appeals resurrected the case earlier this year, saying Jennings deserved a trial to hear the claims. The Supreme Court order puts the case back in Tilley’s court.
